title.narrative: Knowledge is Power III: Educational Activities to Empower Women and Girls in refugee and vulnerable

description.narrative:
The project will contribute to the educational and overall empowerment of Women and Adolescent Girls from refugee and vulnerable host communities in West Bekaa. The main objective of this project is to provide a supportive environment where women and adolescent girls are equipped with educational and vocational skills to increase their chances of employability, support their education and the education of their children, alongside providing social and psycho-social support through stress-relieving activities, access to a safe space and opportunity to network with other women with similar experiences. This project targets women (18+) and adolescent girls (14-17) of both host and refugee communities, residing in central Bekaa, over the period of 12 months.
Activities include: 240 participants will receive English classes 64 participants will receive IT classes 15 participants will receive vocational training through a hygiene production course Ad-hoc support will be offered to participants to support with CV-writing and interview practice. A book club will be run for 60 participants. An arts club will be run (drawing, painting, drama) for 60 participants, with supervision of staff trained in psychosocial support.
